meanings.sent1: The school nurse handles medical issues, but the nonmedical staff help with administrative tasks.
meanings.sent2: She preferred a nonmedical approach to wellness, focusing on exercise and nutrition instead of medication.
meanings.sent3: The nonmedical team members joked that their superpower was keeping the office coffee pot full.
meanings.sent4: Her nonmedical background gave her a unique perspective on healthcare, seeing it from a different angle.
meanings.sent5: The nonmedical nature of the discussion made it easier for everyone to understand without complex jargon.

meanings.sent1: The nonmedical approach to pain management included yoga and meditation.
meanings.sent2: He chose a nonmedical route for his injury, opting for rest and ice instead of medication.
meanings.sent3: The nonmedical solution to the problem surprised everyone with its simplicity.
meanings.sent4: Her nonmedical advice on skincare was to drink more water and get enough sleep.
meanings.sent5: The nonmedical treatment proved effective, showing that sometimes natural remedies work best.

meanings.definition: Not pertaining to the field of medicine.
meanings.sent1: His nonmedical background in engineering brought a fresh perspective to healthcare technology.
meanings.sent2: The conference focused on nonmedical topics like leadership and communication skills.
meanings.sent3: The nonmedical staff organized a fun team-building event for the office.
meanings.sent4: Her nonmedical interests included art and music, providing a well-rounded approach to life.
meanings.sent5: The nonmedical aspect of the project allowed for creativity and innovation outside the medical realm.
